title: Accessibility Enhancements
description: Improve component accessibility with ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, and WCAG compliance.
prompt_text: Make this component more accessible — add ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, and anything else needed to meet WCAG standards.

title: AI Agent Orchestration Strategy Guide
description: Draft a strategy document on AI agent architecture, coordination, and memory systems for software development workflows.
prompt_text: Help me draft a strategy doc on AI agent orchestration in software workflows. I want to understand how companies like Replit (with Ghostwriter), GitHub (with Copilot Agents), and emerging startups are thinking about agent architecture, coordination, and memory. Include tradeoffs they've discussed, challenges in implementation, and diagrams or architecture models if available.

title: AI Assistant Evaluation
description: Analyze and compare different AI assistants for a specific workflow.
prompt_text:
"I need to evaluate different AI assistants (like ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, etc.) for our [specific domain/purpose]. 

Our primary requirements are:
- [Requirement 1, e.g., accuracy in technical content]
- [Requirement 2, e.g., ability to follow complex instructions]
- [Requirement 3, e.g., consistency in output format]

Can you help me create a structured evaluation approach with:
1. Specific test prompts we should use
2. Evaluation criteria and scoring method
3. Important considerations or limitations to be aware of
4. Best practices for conducting a fair comparison"

title: AI Code Scaffold Generator
description: Use OpenAI to generate suggested folder structures and starter functions based on issue descriptions.
prompt_text: "Create a GitHub Action that reads a Markdown spec or issue description, sends it to OpenAI, and asks for a code scaffold suggestion (e.g., folder structure, starter functions). Output it as a comment in the issue thread."

title: AI Config Validator
description: Use OpenAI to scan configuration files and suggest missing environment variables or settings.
prompt_text: "Write a GitHub Action that uses OpenAI to scan all `.env.example`, `.config`, or `.yaml` files in the repo and suggest if any environment variables or settings are missing based on best practices."

title: AI Developer Productivity Case Studies
description: Collect real-world case studies of organizations using AI coding tools to improve development velocity, with measurable outcomes.
prompt_text: Collect 3–5 real-world case studies where AI tools (e.g., Copilot, Cody, internal LLMs) were used to improve software development velocity. For each case: include who implemented it, what the AI was used for (e.g., test generation, code suggestions, PR review), measurable outcomes, and links to deeper writeups or talks.

title: AI Features Implementation Patterns
description: Research common approaches to implementing AI capabilities in small applications, including model selection and user experience considerations.
prompt_text: I'm thinking about adding AI features like summarization, auto-tagging, or writing assistance. What are the most common implementation patterns in small apps? Include model choices (OpenAI vs open-source), latency tradeoffs, and UI/UX integrations that feel seamless.

title: AI-Native App Technical Stack Comparison
description: Compare technical options for building cross-platform AI applications with offline capabilities, with framework pros and cons.
prompt_text: Explore technical options for building an AI-native app with offline capabilities. Compare Electron vs Tauri vs Flutter vs React Native for cross-platform desktop or mobile use, and include examples of apps built on each stack with similar goals.

title: AI Pair Programming Impact Analysis
description: Evaluate the productivity impact and limitations of AI coding tools like GitHub Copilot and Codeium for software development.
prompt_text: Summarize current thinking on AI-powered pair programming. Focus on tools like GitHub Copilot, Codeium, and Replit Ghostwriter. What's the real productivity impact? What problems does it still struggle with (e.g., hallucinations, test coverage)?

title: AI Project Pitch Generator
description: Automatically generate concise project elevator pitches from README changes using OpenAI.
prompt_text: "Help me build a GitHub Action that watches for new `README.md` changes and uses OpenAI to generate a short project elevator pitch in plain language. Save the pitch as `one-liner.txt` in the root."

title: AI Question Responder
description: Generate draft responses to questions in GitHub issues using OpenAI without automatically posting them.
prompt_text: "Help me build a GitHub Action that pulls questions from open issues labeled `question`, sends them to OpenAI's API, and creates a draft response comment. Do not post automatically — just write the comment and tag it as `[AI Draft]`."

title: API Data Fetching Component
description: Implement a frontend component that fetches data from an API using a specified JavaScript framework.
prompt_text: Show me how to wire this front-end component to fetch data from an API. Assume I'm building this in (React/Vue/etc.).

title: API Doc Summary
description: Provide a high-level summary of an API doc and include an example of how to use it.
prompt_text: Give me a high-level summary of this API doc, and include an example of how to use it.

title: API Latency Pattern Analyzer
description: Analyze API request logs to identify patterns in high latency issues and potential bottlenecks
prompt_text: Act as a backend engineer reviewing request logs from an API experiencing high latency. Identify patterns in timing, endpoint usage, or failure codes. Return your analysis in three parts: 1) summary of issues, 2) potential bottlenecks, 3) next steps to isolate root cause. Analyze this data: [PASTE HERE: sampled API logs or latency stats].

title: API Mock Server
description: Create an API mock server that simulates a JSON response for local testing.
prompt_text: Create an API mock server that simulates this JSON response for local testing.

title: API Mock Setup
description: Create a mock implementation of an external API to enable development before the real API is ready.
prompt_text: What's a fast way to mock this external API: (API name or description) so I can start building before it's ready?

title: App Boilerplate Generator
description: Generate starter boilerplate code for a small application with specified core functionality.
prompt_text: Can you generate boilerplate code for a small app using (stack) that supports (core functionality)?

title: App Connection Troubleshooter
description: Analyze data flow between application components to identify missing connection steps.
prompt_text: I'm trying to connect this part of the app to another, but it's not working. Can you check the data flow and see if I missed a step?

title: App Error Pattern Detector
description: Identify recurring error patterns in application logs and recommend targeted debugging steps
prompt_text: Act as a full-stack developer debugging a recurring error in our application. The logs include stack traces, error messages, and request metadata. Extract key failure patterns, identify the most likely root issue, and suggest 2–3 focused debugging steps. Start with this: [PASTE HERE: app logs, stack trace samples, or exception data].

title: Application Error Analyzer
description: Identify and summarize critical error patterns from application logs to prioritize debugging efforts
prompt_text: Act as a senior developer reading app logs. Summarize the frequency and type of errors, and highlight the most critical log lines that might signal a deeper issue. Output: Error Type → Count → Explanation. Review this data: [PASTE HERE: raw application logs].

title: Architecture Approaches
description: Suggest multiple architectural approaches or implementation strategies for a product idea.
prompt_text: Based on this prompt: (describe product idea), what are three possible architectures or approaches I could use to implement it?

title: 3-Sentence Article Summary
description: Turn a long article into a concise 3-sentence summary with the main argument and implications.
prompt_text: Turn this long article into a 3-sentence summary with the main argument and implications.

title: Function Assumption Analyzer
description: Analyze a function for assumptions about inputs, state, or environment that could lead to bugs or brittleness.
prompt_text: Analyze this function: [paste code] and point out any assumptions it's making (e.g., about inputs, state, environment) that could lead to bugs or brittleness.

title: Basic Auth Flow Implementation
description: Implement a complete authentication flow with signup, login, logout, and password reset functionality.
prompt_text: Build a basic authentication flow using [choose: Supabase, Firebase Auth, Clerk, or NextAuth]. Include pages and forms for signup, login, logout, and password reset, with simple input validation and redirect logic to a protected dashboard page.

title: Basic CRUD Flow Generator
description: Generate code for a complete CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) flow for a specific data model.
prompt_text: Write a basic CRUD flow for this data model: (paste model or describe it) using (your framework of choice).

title: Basic RESTful API Setup
description: Create a RESTful API that supports CRUD operations for resources with user-specific access control.
prompt_text: Create a basic RESTful API using Express (or use Next.js API routes) that supports GET, POST, PUT, and DELETE for a projects resource. Structure it so each user can CRUD their own project data, assuming they're identified via user ID.

title: Beginner-Friendly Error Explainer
description: Decode error messages in simple, jargon-free language suitable for coding beginners.
prompt_text: Explain what this error message means like you're talking to someone brand new to coding — no jargon unless you explain it too.

title: Blog Action Summary
description: Summarize a blog post and suggest what action a developer might take after reading it.
prompt_text: Summarize this blog post and suggest what action a developer might take after reading it.

title: Blog or Memo to Presentation
description: Convert a blog post or internal memo into a presentation, breaking it into slide-friendly chunks with titles, key bullets, and optional visuals.
prompt_text: Create a presentation version of this blog post or internal memo. Break it into slide-friendly chunks with titles, key bullets, and optional visuals. [PASTE HERE: full blog post or doc you want to convert.]

title: Broken Workflow Debugging
description: Analyze a broken GitHub Actions workflow line by line to identify and fix problems.
prompt_text: Here's a broken GitHub Actions workflow: "[paste YAML]". Can you walk through it line by line, explain what it does, and help me fix any mistakes?

title: Bug Label Slack Notifier
description: Set up a workflow that sends formatted Slack notifications for open bug-labeled issues.
prompt_text: Set up a workflow that pulls all open issues with the bug label and sends a Slack message with a summary (title, link, priority label if any). Format it nicely using a Slack webhook.

title: Bug Risk Scan
description: Scan code for areas likely to introduce bugs, highlight risky patterns or edge cases, and suggest tests or fixes.
prompt_text: Scan this file for areas that are likely to introduce bugs. Highlight risky patterns or edge cases and suggest how I could test or fix them.

title: Build Artifact Packager
description: Create a GitHub Action that compresses build output and uploads it as a uniquely named artifact.
prompt_text: Create a GitHub Action that zips up a specific directory (/dist or /build) after a successful CI run and uploads it as a build artifact. Name it using the commit SHA and timestamp.

title: Bundle Size Monitor
description: Create a GitHub Action that monitors and records JavaScript bundle size changes across builds.
prompt_text: I want a GitHub Action that monitors the size of my production JavaScript bundle over time. Store the size and commit hash in a bundle-history.json file for each run.

title: Button Event Troubleshooter
description: Debug button click events by checking event bindings and function calls.
prompt_text: Nothing is happening when I click this button. Can you check if it's wired up correctly, and if the function it calls is working?

title: Changelog TL;DR
description: Create a TL;DR version of a changelog, focused on what a developer needs to know.
prompt_text: Create a TL;DR version of this changelog, focused on what a developer needs to know.

title: Clarity Editor
description: Edit text to improve clarity, reduce ambiguity, and make it more concise, especially for an audience with limited time.
prompt_text: Edit this text to improve clarity, reduce ambiguity, and make it more concise — especially for an audience with limited time.

title: Clean HTML CSS Rewrite
description: Rewrite messy layouts into clean, readable HTML and CSS with improved spacing and structure.
prompt_text: Please rewrite this messy layout into clean, readable HTML + CSS with good spacing and structure.

title: CLI Tool Starter Code
description: Generate starter code for a command-line interface tool that performs a specific task.
prompt_text: Give me starter code for a CLI tool that does this: (describe task) using (language).

title: Code Block Explainer
description: Break down code into logical blocks and explain the purpose of each part in plain language.
prompt_text: Here's a chunk of code: [paste code]. Help me break it down into logical blocks and explain the purpose of each part in plain language.

title: Code Change Comparison
description: Compare current and previous code versions to identify changes that caused problems.
prompt_text: I changed something and now it's broken. Can you compare the current code to the earlier version and show what changed that caused the problem?

title: Code Dependency Analyzer
description: Identify upstream and downstream dependencies of a module within a complex system
prompt_text: Act as a backend engineer reading a system with lots of cross-dependencies. Identify what services or files this one depends on, and what depends on it. Output format: Imports, Exports, Upstream, Downstream. Use this code: [PASTE HERE: a module or service config].

title: Code Execution Profiler
description: Identify performance bottlenecks in system traces and logs with clear component-level timing breakdowns
prompt_text: Act as a code-execution profiler. Review this trace or log and explain which parts of the system are taking the most time, and why. Output format: Component → Time Taken → Likely Bottleneck. Analyze this: [PASTE HERE: performance trace, Flamegraph data, or APM export].

title: Code Execution Simulator
description: Simulate code execution to identify potential crash points, failures, or unexpected return values.
prompt_text: Can you simulate how this code would run and point out anything that might crash, fail, or return something weird?

title: Code Expectation Explainer
description: Analyze code to explain what it should do, what it's actually doing, and how to fix it in plain language.
prompt_text: This code isn't doing what I expected: (paste code). Can you tell me what it *should* do, what it's actually doing, and how to fix it in plain English?

title: Code Formatting PR Check
description: Generate a workflow that automatically checks pull requests for code formatting issues using Prettier.
prompt_text: Generate a workflow that runs on every pull request to main, checks for code formatting with Prettier, and leaves a comment on the PR if formatting issues are found.

title: Code History Analyzer
description: Reconstruct the history and evolution of code by examining patterns, comments, and structure
prompt_text: Act as a code historian. Based on the code comments, naming, and structure, infer what this code might have originally been written for, and whether it's still doing that. Point out any legacy patterns or dead code. Use this file: [PASTE HERE: source file or class].

title: Code Logic Placement Advisor
description: Evaluate whether code logic is in the appropriate location and suggest better alternatives if needed.
prompt_text: Is this the right place in the code for this logic? If not, where should it go and why?

title: Code Refactor Suggestions
description: Suggest ways to refactor inefficient or clunky code for better performance or clarity, and explain pros and cons.
prompt_text: Here's some inefficient or clunky code: [paste code]. Suggest ways to refactor it for better performance or clarity. Also explain the pros and cons of your approach.

title: Code Refactoring Guide
description: Receive structured suggestions to improve code readability, modularity, and maintainability
prompt_text: Act as a refactoring guide. Suggest ways to improve the readability, modularity, or maintainability of this code. Output format: Original Block → Suggested Change → Reason. Analyze this code: [PASTE HERE: one class, module, or script].

title: Code Syntax Error Checker
description: Identify missing imports, mismatched brackets, typos, and other small syntax errors causing bugs.
prompt_text: Can you help me find missing or incorrect imports, mismatched brackets, or small typos that might be causing bugs in this code?

title: Code vs Intent Analyzer
description: Compare intended functionality against actual code to identify missing or incorrect implementations.
prompt_text: Here's what I *wanted* this code to do: (describe your goal). Can you compare that to the code and tell me if anything is missing or backward?

title: Codebase Summary Generator
description: Generate clear summaries of unfamiliar code modules including their purpose and system connections
prompt_text: Act as a senior software engineer reviewing an unfamiliar codebase. Provide a summary of what this file or module does, who might use it, and how it connects to other parts of the system. Use this input: [PASTE HERE: a source file or class].

title: Competitor Sentiment Analysis
description: Analyze public user sentiment about competitors by reviewing feedback across multiple platforms to identify strengths and pain points.
prompt_text: Analyze public sentiment around [insert competitor name or adjacent product] by reviewing user feedback from G2, Reddit threads, Twitter posts, and app store reviews (if mobile). Summarize recurring themes across strengths, pain points, common complaints, and wishlist features. Include quoted examples where possible.

title: Complex Topic to Simple Slides
description: Explain a complex technical topic to a non-technical audience in 4–5 slides using analogies, simplified visuals, and real-world examples.
prompt_text: I need to explain this complex technical topic to a non-technical audience. Help me turn it into 4–5 slides with analogies, simplified visuals, and real-world examples. [PASTE HERE: the topic, and what audience you're presenting to.]

title: Component Structure Improvement
description: Analyze and improve the structure, readability, and accessibility of a component.
prompt_text: Here's a component I'm working on: (paste code). Can you suggest ways to improve its structure, readability, and accessibility?

title: Component Refactoring Guide
description: Break down a large component into smaller, more manageable standalone components.
prompt_text: Help me refactor this giant component into smaller ones. Break it down and explain which pieces should become standalone components.

title: Conditional Test Workflow
description: Create a GitHub Action that only runs tests when specific files or directories have been modified.
prompt_text: Create a GitHub Action that only runs tests if files in the src/ directory have changed. Otherwise, it should skip the job and print a message.

title: Confidential Cloud Computing Comparison
description: Analyze the current state of confidential compute offerings from major cloud providers, with use cases and technical limitations.
prompt_text: Summarize the current state of confidential compute in cloud infrastructure (as of 2024). I want to understand how AWS Nitro Enclaves, Azure Confidential VMs, and GCP's Confidential Space compare. Include common use cases (e.g., AI model privacy, finance), technical limitations, and industry adoption data if available. Prioritize first-party docs, academic sources, or respected analysts.

title: Config Option Extractor
description: Extract key configuration options from a YAML or JSON file and explain what each does.
prompt_text: Extract the key configuration options from this YAML/JSON file and explain what each does.

title: Config File Change Validator
description: Build a GitHub Action that detects, validates, and reports issues in configuration file changes.
prompt_text: Build a GitHub Action that detects changes to config files, runs a linter or validator, and posts a comment on the pull request summarizing any issues.

title: Contributor Stats Leaderboard
description: Create a GitHub Action that collects repository contribution statistics and generates a leaderboard.
prompt_text: Create a GitHub Action that pulls contribution stats (e.g., top contributors this month, number of PRs, commits) and generates a leaderboard-style markdown file. Update it weekly.

title: Cross-Functional Program Kickoff Messaging
description: Craft compelling program kickoff messaging that drives alignment across multiple teams and functions
prompt_text: Act as a TPM helping frame kickoff messaging for cross-functional alignment. The program has ambitious goals, but teams are unclear about their role and impact. Write a 1-slide summary that explains the "why now," shared goals, and how each org contributes. Be confident, collaborative, and motivating. Provide two headline options: one product-centric, one infrastructure-focused. Use this background to help craft the message: [PASTE HERE: list of goals, teams involved, and a short description of urgency or opportunity].

title: Cross-Repo Data Sync
description: Create a GitHub Action that pulls data from a secondary repository, processes it, and stores the results.
prompt_text: Write a GitHub Action that clones a secondary repo, pulls in the latest JSON data from it, processes it with a script, and stores the result in this repo as part of a nightly data sync.

title: Daily Data Fetch Commit
description: Set up a GitHub Action that automatically fetches data from an API and commits the results daily.
prompt_text: I want to run a script in my repo once a day that fetches data from an API and commits the updated results to the repo. Can you help me write that GitHub Action and the script?

title: Dark Mode UI Card Design
description: Generate Tailwind or CSS code for a UI card with image, title, and button that includes hover and dark mode support.
prompt_text: Give me Tailwind (or CSS) code for a UI card that includes: (image + title + button) with hover and dark mode support.

title: Dark Mode Conversion
description: Add dark mode support to an application while maintaining visual quality across both modes.
prompt_text: Help me make this app dark mode–friendly. Add the necessary styles and make sure everything still looks good.

title: Dashboard Export Summarizer
description: Transform technical dashboard exports into stakeholder-friendly summaries with clear sections and next steps
prompt_text: Act as a dashboard summarizer. I want to convert this dashboard export into something a stakeholder could read. Organize it into sections: Metrics Overview, Notable Changes, and Potential Next Steps. Work from this: [PASTE HERE: JSON export or tabular data from monitoring/BI tool].

title: Dashboard Mock Data Generator
description: Generate realistic mock data for a SaaS dashboard including projects, logs, and metrics.
prompt_text: Generate mock data for a SaaS dashboard — for example, fake projects, recent activity logs, and user metrics. Insert them into the UI using hardcoded arrays or a local JSON file so I can demo the app without a backend.

title: Dataset Pattern Analyzer
description: Review datasets to identify key trends, unexpected behaviors, and follow-up questions in plain language
prompt_text: Act as a technical analyst. Review this dataset and explain the most important patterns and outliers in plain English. Organize your output into: (1) Key Trends, (2) Unexpected Behavior, (3) Questions We Should Ask Next. Use this data: [PASTE HERE: raw table, JSON object, CSV content, or metric excerpt].

title: Debugging Blog Closing
description: Craft a meaningful closing paragraph for a blog post about debugging distributed systems.
prompt_text: Write a closing paragraph for a blog post about debugging distributed systems. I want to leave readers with a clear takeaway, a reminder to be patient with themselves, and an invitation to share their own stories.

title: Debugging Checklist Creator
description: Generate a comprehensive step-by-step checklist for troubleshooting broken code.
prompt_text: Make a checklist of simple things I can check when something breaks — like step-by-step, even if they seem obvious.

title: Decision-Making Doc Converter
description: Convert a document into a decision-making doc with clear purpose, context, risks, alternatives, and recommendation.
prompt_text: Convert this document into a decision-making doc (similar to Amazon's 1-pagers or PR/FAQs). Reformat it so the purpose, context, risks, alternatives, and recommendation are clear. [PASTE HERE: informal or scattered planning content.]

title: Demo Banner Implementation
description: Add a banner to indicate prototype status while maintaining good design principles.
prompt_text: Insert a banner at the top of every page that says 'This is a demo prototype – data will not be saved.' Style it clearly but unobtrusively (e.g., light yellow background, dark text, closeable).

title: Demo Deployment Preparation
description: Prepare a prototype for deployment with proper environment setup, documentation, and sharing capabilities.
prompt_text: Prepare this prototype for demo deployment using Vercel or Netlify. Set up environment variables (e.g., for API keys), add a README.md with setup instructions, and generate a shareable link with a temporary subdomain like my-saas-demo.vercel.app.

title: Dependency Changelog Summarizer
description: Create a GitHub Action that watches for dependency updates and posts changelog summaries to pull requests.
prompt_text: Make a GitHub Action that watches for dependency updates, runs a script that summarizes the changelogs of updated packages, and posts the summary to the pull request as a comment.

title: Deploy to Hosting Workflow
description: Create a GitHub Action that builds and deploys a project to Vercel or Netlify when merging to main.
prompt_text: Create a GitHub Action that builds my project and deploys it to Vercel (or Netlify) when I merge to `main`. Include environment setup and secrets configuration instructions.

title: Deployment Failure Diagnostics
description: Pinpoint the exact cause of deployment failures from logs and identify improvement areas
prompt_text: Act as a DevOps engineer reviewing deployment logs for a failed rollout. Pinpoint where the failure occurred, what component it was in, and whether it's config, code, or infra-related. Also flag any misleading or missing log entries. Use this input: [PASTE HERE: deploy script output or CI/CD pipeline logs].

title: Docs Quality Reviewer
description: Automatically review documentation for grammar, tone, and clarity using OpenAI when changes are made.
prompt_text: "Write a GitHub Action that monitors the `/docs` folder. If a markdown file is changed, send the new version to OpenAI and ask it to review for grammar, tone, and clarity. Post suggestions as a pull request comment."

title: Document Action Items Checklist
description: Extract all action items, decisions made, and follow-ups from documents, formatting them into a checklist with owner names if available.
prompt_text: Extract all action items, decisions made, and follow-ups from these documents. Format them into a checklist with owner names (if available). [PASTE HERE: meeting notes, standup logs, or planning docs.]

title: Document Synthesis by Theme
description: Synthesize multiple documents into a single, easy-to-skim summary grouped by theme or topic, removing redundant or outdated content.
prompt_text: Turn these docs into a single, easy-to-skim synthesis. Group information by theme or topic and remove redundant or outdated content. [PASTE HERE: any combination of docs you want merged — e.g., brainstorm notes, specs, or research summaries.]

title: Document Viewpoint Comparison
description: Compare viewpoints or priorities across multiple documents, identifying alignment, differences, conflicts, and gaps.
prompt_text: Compare the viewpoints or priorities across these documents and identify where they align, where they differ, and where there are conflicts or gaps. [PASTE HERE: multiple stakeholder docs, project briefs, or competing proposals.]

title: Easy Responsive Layout
description: Create a layout that looks good on both desktop and mobile devices without requiring deep CSS knowledge.
prompt_text: Make this layout look good on both desktop and mobile without me needing to learn CSS.

title: Engineering OKR Suggestions
description: Generate potential engineering objectives and key results across technical initiatives, team health, and organizational enablement.
prompt_text: We're planning our Q3 engineering OKRs. Based on past initiatives (e.g., improving reliability, boosting developer experience, experimenting with AI), suggest 5 new OKR directions. I'd like a mix of technical bets, team health goals, and cross-org enablers, each written in a draft objective + key result format.

title: Engineering Standards Implementation Strategies
description: Compare how different organizations implement and enforce engineering standards at scale, from dedicated teams to tooling automation.
prompt_text: Compare org-level strategies for implementing engineering standards at scale. Include examples like Google's eng productivity team, Meta's code health initiatives, and medium-sized companies with working style guides or linters-as-a-service.

title: Error Message Decoder
description: Analyze error messages to identify their source and provide clear solutions.
prompt_text: I just ran this and got an error: (paste error message). What does it mean, where is it coming from, and how do I fix it?

title: Error Message Explainer
description: Explain an error message, its stack origin, and how to resolve it for someone unfamiliar with the error.
prompt_text: Here’s an error message I don’t understand: [paste error]. Can you explain what it means, what part of the stack it’s coming from, and how to resolve it — assume I’m not familar at all with this error

title: Error Report Interpreter
description: Decode error reports by identifying root causes, frequency patterns, and highlighting recent occurrences
prompt_text: Act as a developer support assistant. Help me understand this error report by identifying: common root causes, frequency of each type, and which errors have occurred recently. Use this log sample: [PASTE HERE: list of error messages or codes with timestamps].

title: Error Root Cause Explainer
description: Walk through possible root causes for an error, explain what it means, and show how to fix it.
prompt_text: I'm getting this error: [paste error message]. Can you walk me through possible root causes step by step, explain what the error means, and show how to fix it?

title: Error Tracking Proposal
description: Craft a detailed proposal for implementing Sentry error tracking in a frontend application.
prompt_text: Write a proposal for adding error tracking to our frontend app using Sentry. I want to explain the current gap, how Sentry would help, what it would cost us (in time or complexity), and the tradeoffs.

title: Executive Brief Rewrite
description: Rewrite a document as an executive brief, removing detail, emphasizing outcomes, clarifying ownership, and cutting the fluff.
prompt_text: Rewrite this document as if it were a brief for an exec — remove detail, emphasize outcomes, clarify ownership, and cut the fluff. [PASTE HERE: original draft, team writeup, or planning doc.]

title: Executive Summary from Documents
description: Analyze multiple documents and create a 1-page executive summary with key themes, major decisions, and open questions for readers who haven't read the full docs.
prompt_text: Analyze the following documents and create a 1-page executive summary that includes key themes, major decisions, and open questions. Make it suitable for someone who hasn't read the full documents. [PASTE HERE: all relevant meeting notes, strategy docs, or planning memos.]

title: External API Data Fetcher
description: Build a GitHub Action that retrieves data from external APIs, formats it as markdown, and saves it to the repository.
prompt_text: Build a GitHub Action that fetches data from an external API (e.g., Hacker News, GitHub API, etc.), extracts relevant info (like top 5 items), formats it into a markdown file, and commits it to the repo.

title: Feature Component Scaffold
description: Generate scaffolding code for the main components or functions needed to build a specific feature.
prompt_text: Here's what I want this feature to do: (describe feature). Can you scaffold the main components or functions I'd need to build it?

title: Feature Rollout Edge Cases
description: Identify potential risks, edge cases, and overlooked scenarios when implementing a new product feature.
prompt_text: Give me a list of edge cases or risks we might overlook during this feature rollout. Think about user state, permissions, latency, mobile usage, etc. [Briefly describe the feature's goal and how it works.]

title: Figma to Code Converter
description: Convert Figma designs or mockup descriptions into styled code using a specified framework.
prompt_text: Here's a Figma design (or mockup description): (paste details). Help me convert it into styled JSX/HTML/CSS using (framework).

title: File Structure Suggester
description: Suggest a better file structure or modular breakdown for code, using best practices in the stack.
prompt_text: Suggest a better file structure or modular breakdown for this code: [paste code or describe file], using common best practices in this stack.

title: Focus-Trapping Modal
description: Design a modal that traps focus, handles keyboard and click interactions, and works in both light and dark modes.
prompt_text: Help me design a modal that traps focus, handles close via ESC key and clicking outside, and works in both light and dark mode.

title: Fragmented Notes to Memo
description: Turn fragmented notes into a coherent, professional, and outcome-oriented draft memo or strategy document.
prompt_text: Turn these fragmented notes into a coherent draft memo or strategy doc. Keep the voice professional, focused, and outcome-oriented. [PASTE HERE: scattered notes, bullet points, or Slack excerpts.]

title: Function Line-by-Line Explainer
description: Break down code functions with detailed line-by-line explanations for developer onboarding
prompt_text: Act as a code explainer onboarding a new developer. Break down this function line by line. For each line, explain what it does and why it might be necessary. Format as: Line → Explanation. Work from this snippet: [PASTE HERE: one function or method].

title: Function Logic Analyzer
description: Walk through function execution with test examples to pinpoint incorrect behavior and results.
prompt_text: This function runs, but it's giving me the wrong result. Can you walk through it with test examples to find where it goes wrong?

title: Future Developer Environments Whitepaper

title: Refactoring Strategy Plan
description: Generate a comprehensive strategy document for a major codebase refactoring project.
prompt_text:
I need to create a strategy document for a major codebase refactoring project. Please help me draft this document with the following sections:

1. **Executive Summary**: Brief overview of the refactoring initiative, goals, and expected outcomes.

2. **Current State Assessment**: Analysis of the existing codebase, architecture, and technology stack.

3. **Problems and Pain Points**: Identification of the issues that necessitate refactoring.

4. **Proposed Technical Approach**: Detailed technical strategy including patterns, technologies, and methodologies.

5. **Timeline and Milestones**: Phased approach with key deliverables and checkpoints.

6. **Resource Requirements**: Team composition, skill requirements, and tooling needs.

7. **Risk Assessment**: Potential risks and mitigation strategies.

8. **Success Metrics**: How we'll measure the success of the refactoring project.

For each section, please provide a brief description of what should be included and 2-3 guiding questions that will help me complete it effectively.

prompt_text: Combine these product or feature writeups into a unified roadmap summary. Include the problem each feature solves, high-level implementation notes, and priority level if mentioned. [PASTE HERE: feature briefs, Jira tickets, or product docs.]

title: SaaS App Prototype Scaffold
description: Generate a basic project scaffold for a SaaS application with frontend, backend, and essential pages.
prompt_text: I want to prototype a SaaS app that does [brief description of functionality, e.g., 'helps remote teams track daily standups']. Can you generate a basic project scaffold with a front end (React or Next.js), minimal backend (Node.js/Express or Next.js API routes), and file structure that includes pages for login, dashboard, and settings?

title: SaaS Dashboard Layout
description: Create a responsive dashboard layout with sidebar navigation, top nav, and content area using Tailwind CSS.
prompt_text: Design a SaaS dashboard layout using Tailwind CSS. Include a collapsible sidebar on the left with icons for navigation (Dashboard, Projects, Settings), a top nav with a user avatar and logout button, and a main content area that can hold dynamic content.

title: Sample Data Stubber
description: Generate sample data and stub functions to simulate app behavior.
prompt_text: Generate sample data and stub functions so I can simulate how this app will behave.

title: Scaffolding Code Drafter
description: Draft scaffolding code that sets up an app with minimal boilerplate.
prompt_text: Draft some scaffolding code that sets up this app with minimal boilerplate.

title: Scheduled Issue Summary
description: Create a GitHub Action that regularly collects labeled issues and generates a markdown summary.
prompt_text: Create a GitHub Action that runs on a schedule (every morning) and pulls the latest issues with a specific label from this repo. Format them into a markdown summary and commit it to status.md in the repo.

title: Scheduled Slack Notification
description: Create a GitHub Action that runs on a schedule and sends notifications to Slack.
prompt_text: Set up a scheduled GitHub Action that runs every Monday at 8am UTC and posts a message to Slack via a webhook. Show me where to add the secret securely.

title: Secure Secrets Environment
description: Learn how to properly define and use secrets and environment variables in GitHub Actions workflows.
prompt_text: I want to define secrets and environment variables in a secure way for my GitHub Action — show me how to add them and reference them in the workflow YAML.

title: Security-Focused Code Review
description: Identify security vulnerabilities and fragile code patterns with inline annotations
prompt_text: Act as a security-minded engineer reviewing this code. Identify anything that looks risky or fragile — e.g., hardcoded values, unchecked input, or insecure dependencies. Annotate your findings inline with comments. Review this: [PASTE HERE: function, route, or API handler].

title: Segment Open-Source Alternatives Comparison
description: Map the landscape of open-source alternatives to Segment, including feature completeness, community support, and integration details.
prompt_text: Map the open-source landscape of alternatives to Segment (e.g., RudderStack, Snowplow, PostHog). For each tool, include strengths, feature completeness, GitHub activity, community support, integration effort, and compatibility with typical SaaS data stacks.

title: Server Outage Root Cause Analyzer
description: Identify the root cause of server outages from logs and suggest monitoring improvements
prompt_text: Act as a senior developer and incident responder. You're reviewing server logs after an unexpected outage. Identify the root cause, affected systems, and likely trigger. Suggest what could be added to logging or monitoring to catch this sooner next time. Use this log excerpt: [PASTE HERE: server log or relevant trace output].

title: Service Class Skeleton
description: Generate a skeleton structure for a service or class with a specific core responsibility.
prompt_text: Can you write the skeleton of a service or class that handles (core responsibility)? Leave room for me to fill in the details.

title: Shared Understanding Artifact
description: Turn multiple documents into a shared understanding artifact for onboarding or team alignment, including the why, what, how, and key people involved.
prompt_text: Turn these docs into a shared understanding artifact — something a new team member could read to get up to speed. It should include the why, what, how, and key people involved. [PASTE HERE: multiple docs, briefs, or tickets across a project or stream of work.]

title: Side-by-Side Doc Comparison
description: Create a side-by-side comparison of two documents, highlighting similarities, differences, and missing or contradictory information.
prompt_text: Create a side-by-side comparison of these two documents. Highlight similarities, differences, and where information is missing or contradictory. [PASTE HERE: two versions of a proposal, plan, or design doc.]

title: Simple CLI Tool Builder
description: Turn an idea into a simple CLI tool for local testing.
prompt_text: Turn this idea into a simple CLI tool that I can test locally.

title: Simple Data Model Design
description: Design a straightforward data model for a specific use case that's suitable for prototyping.
prompt_text: Help me design a data model for this use case: (describe idea). Keep it simple and ready for prototyping.

title: Simple Test Workflow
description: Set up a GitHub Action that automatically runs tests when code is pushed to the main branch.
prompt_text: I want to set up a GitHub Action that runs tests whenever I push to the `main` branch. Can you write a simple YAML workflow using `[e.g., Node.js, Python, etc.]` that installs dependencies and runs tests?

title: Simple UI Sketch
description: Generate a simple UI implementation for a concept using a specified framework without focusing on polish.
prompt_text: Sketch out a simple UI for this idea using (framework). Just enough to show the concept — no polish needed.

title: Simplest Stack Suggester
description: Suggest the simplest stack to test a concept without over-engineering it.
prompt_text: What’s the simplest stack I can use to test this concept without over-engineering it?

title: Slide Deck Review for Detail, Context & Appendix
description: Review a slide deck and identify slides that are too detailed, need more context, or could be moved to an appendix.
prompt_text: "Review this deck and tell me: which slides are too detailed, which need more context, and what could be moved to an appendix. [PASTE HERE: slide content or outline.]"

title: Slide Design Helper
description: Help design a slide for a specific message by suggesting a title, 3 concise bullets, and a simple visual or chart idea.
prompt_text: Help me design a slide for this message: [PASTE HERE: what you want to say]. Suggest a title, 3 concise bullets, and a simple visual or chart idea to support it.

title: Slide Presentation from Content
description: Turn content into a 5-slide presentation that clearly explains the idea, the problem it solves, how it works, and what comes next.
prompt_text: Turn this content into a 5-slide presentation that clearly explains the idea, the problem it solves, how it works, and what comes next. [PASTE HERE: notes, outline, or rough draft of a doc, project, or idea.]

title: Slide Rewrite for Clarity
description: Rewrite slides to improve clarity, tone, and visual flow by removing jargon, simplifying headlines, and suggesting better slide titles.
prompt_text: Rewrite these slides to improve clarity, tone, and visual flow. Remove jargon, simplify headlines, and suggest better slide titles. [PASTE HERE: slide text or exported presentation content.]

title: Slide Takeaways to Speaker Script
description: Extract key takeaways from a presentation and rewrite them as a slide-by-slide speaker script with core points, data callouts, and audience tie-ins.
prompt_text: Extract the key takeaways from this presentation and rewrite them as a slide-by-slide speaker script. Each note should include the core point, data callout (if any), and a sentence that ties it back to the audience's goals. [PASTE HERE: deck outline or slide text.]

title: Smart Alerting Condition Generator
description: Create targeted alert conditions based on log trends, error frequencies, and failure cascades
prompt_text: Act as an SRE designing smarter alerting. Review these logs and propose 5 alert conditions based on trends, error frequency, or failure cascades. Output format: Alert Name, Trigger Pattern, Recommended Threshold, Severity. Use this context: [PASTE HERE: error logs and time series].

title: So What Implications Extractor
description: Extract the implications, hidden assumptions, and important decisions suggested by documents, even if not stated directly.
prompt_text: Extract the so what from these documents — what are the implications, hidden assumptions, or important decisions these docs suggest without saying directly? [PASTE HERE: product specs, strategy docs, or team notes.]

title: Software Engineering Effectiveness Research
description: Identify and summarize influential academic and industry papers on software engineering effectiveness and their relation to modern practices.
prompt_text: Find the most cited or respected academic or industry papers that define or influence thinking around software engineering effectiveness (e.g., from ACM, IEEE, Google, Microsoft Research). Summarize key frameworks and findings, and explain how they relate to modern practices like trunk-based development, remote teams, or AI-enhanced coding.

title: Source-to-Documentation Transformer
description: Convert source code files into comprehensive internal documentation with structured sections
prompt_text: Act as a technical documentation assistant. Turn this source file into internal documentation. Include: module summary, key functions, data structures used, and any known edge cases. Here's the file: [PASTE HERE: full source file or key class].

title: Speed vs Quality Engineering Tradeoffs
description: Explore diverse industry perspectives on the balance between development velocity and code quality, especially in the context of AI tools.
prompt_text: Collect a range of industry views on the tradeoff between speed and quality in modern engineering — especially with the rise of AI tooling. Include perspectives from productivity-focused teams, software craftsmanship advocates, and product-first orgs. I want contrasting views, memorable quotes, and examples of teams choosing one side over the other.

title: Stakeholder Review Optimized Rewrite
description: Rewrite a document to optimize it for stakeholder review, clarifying language, tightening structure, and making the ask or decision clear.
prompt_text: Help me rewrite this document so that it's optimized for stakeholder review. Clarify language, tighten structure, and make sure the 'ask' or decision is crystal clear. [PASTE HERE: your draft proposal, one-pager, or product pitch.]

title: Steps and Gaps Finder
description: Identify the steps described in documentation and highlight potential gaps or assumptions.
prompt_text: What are the steps described here, and where are there potential gaps or assumptions?

title: Stepwise Builder
description: Build a project in stages: first a sketch, then a prototype, then real code.
prompt_text: Walk me through building this in stages: first a sketch, then a prototype, then real code.

title: Story-Driven Slide Deck Rewrite
description: Make a slide deck more story-driven by rewriting headlines and flow to walk through the problem, tension, opportunity, and solution.
prompt_text: "Make this slide deck more story-driven. Rewrite the headlines and flow to walk through: (1) the problem, (2) the tension, (3) the opportunity, and (4) our solution. [PASTE HERE: deck headlines or slide text.]"

title: Strategic Reviewer Feedback
description: Act as a strategic reviewer and provide feedback on what's missing, unclear, and what questions a skeptical reader would ask.
prompt_text: "Act as a strategic reviewer. Read this doc and tell me: 1) what's missing, 2) what's unclear, and 3) what questions a skeptical reader would ask. [PASTE HERE: roadmap, product spec, or decision doc.]"

title: Strategy Rollout Timeline
description: Create a timeline for strategy rollout, including milestones, review points, and feedback loops, accounting for resources and priorities.
prompt_text: Create a timeline for the strategy rollout, including key milestones, review points, and feedback loops. Ensure the timeline accounts for resource availability and organizational priorities. [PASTE HERE: Strategy components and resource allocation]

title: System Crash Correlation Finder
description: Identify connections between resource usage metrics and application crashes
prompt_text: Act as a site reliability engineer reviewing crash logs and system resource metrics. Find correlations between CPU/memory usage spikes and app behavior. Return your findings as bullet points: what correlates, what doesn't, and what to monitor. Analyze the following: [PASTE HERE: log output + resource usage over time].

title: Tailwind Class Optimization
description: Review Tailwind class usage and suggest simplifications or better utility combinations.
prompt_text: Here's a UI built with Tailwind. Can you review the class usage and suggest simplifications or better utility combinations?

title: Tailwind Design System
description: Define a consistent design system with Tailwind CSS that can be applied across an entire application.
prompt_text: Create a basic design system using Tailwind. Define base spacing (e.g., padding, margin), font sizes, heading styles, and standard button styles. Apply these consistently across the landing page, dashboard, and settings pages.

title: Tech Debt Sprint Theme Ideas
description: Generate energizing and slightly humorous sprint names that can rally a team around technical debt cleanup work.
prompt_text: We're running a tech debt sprint. Suggest 5 energizing and slightly cheeky sprint themes or names we could use to rally the team — something like 'Dustbuster Week' or 'The Great Refactorening' — that keep things light while staying focused.

title: Technical Debt Management at Scale
description: Research how leading companies systematically track, prioritize, and address technical debt while balancing feature development.
prompt_text: What are leading approaches for managing internal technical debt at scale? Include systems for surfacing and prioritizing tech debt (e.g., Atlassian's Tech Debt Wall of Shame, Airbnb's quarterly tech debt days), and how teams balance roadmap vs refactoring work.

title: Technical Decision Thread
description: Create a compelling Twitter thread that explains the reasoning behind a technical or product decision.
prompt_text: Help me write a thread that explains this technical or product decision we made — and why it mattered. Start with a strong hook, walk through 3–5 points, and end with a reflection or takeaway. [PASTE HERE: what the decision was, what the options were, and the final choice.]

title: Technical Demo Thread
description: Create a Twitter thread that showcases a technical feature, capability, or code technique with clear examples.
prompt_text:
Help me create a Twitter thread that demonstrates this technical feature/capability: [FEATURE NAME]

Details about what it does and why it matters:
[DETAILS]

Any code examples or specific points I should highlight:
[CODE/POINTS]

title: Technical Docs Human Explainer
description: Turn technical documentation into a clear, impact-focused explainer for non-engineering stakeholders.
prompt_text: Write a 'for humans' explainer that turns this technical documentation into something a non-engineering stakeholder could understand. Focus on clarity and impact, not code. [PASTE HERE: technical specs, infra docs, or architectural plans.]

title: Technical Program Charter Template
description: Create comprehensive program charters for large-scale technical initiatives with executive and engineering versions
prompt_text: Act as an expert TPM with experience launching high-scale backend systems. I'm kicking off a multi-quarter program to unify telemetry across products. Write a first draft of a program charter that includes: purpose, scope, success metrics, stakeholders, and known risks. Make it concise and executive-ready. Generate two versions — one formal for leadership, one more detailed for engineering teams. Use this input: [PASTE HERE: description of the program's intent, timeline, and any existing notes or expectations].

title: Technical Program Retrospective Template
description: Create structured, insightful retrospectives for technical initiatives with actionable lessons learned
prompt_text: Act as a TPM writing a retrospective for a recently completed technical initiative. The project was delivered on time but revealed gaps in triage tooling and stakeholder alignment. Draft a retrospective report with sections: Goals, Wins, Challenges, Lessons Learned, Next Steps. Use a professional and constructive tone. Generate two versions: one full-length for docs, one short for email. Use this initiative summary: [PASTE HERE: high-level project summary, key outcomes, and any documented challenges].

title: Template & Example Generator
description: Give specific examples or templates for workflows, documents, or training, especially ones that are actionable and beginner-friendly.
prompt_text: Give me specific examples or templates for [workflow/document/training], especially ones that are actionable and beginner-friendly.

title: Test Package Deploy Workflow
description: Create a GitHub Action that runs tests, packages the output, and deploys it to a staging server.
prompt_text: Create a workflow that runs tests, then packages the compiled site into a .zip file, uploads it as an artifact, and also deploys it to a staging server using an SSH deploy step.

title: Test YAML Resilience
description: This is a test prompt with formatting issues: trailing spaces and unexpected characters at line end.
prompt_text: Help me test the YAML parser resilience. This prompt intentionally has issues like unexpected scalar at node end.

title: Timeline, Dependencies & Blockers Checklist
description: Extract all timelines, dependencies, and blockers from planning documents and create a bulleted checklist organized by owner, priority, and sequence.
prompt_text: Extract all timelines, dependencies, and blockers from these planning documents. Create a bulleted checklist organized by owner, priority, and sequence. [PASTE HERE: cross-functional plans, epic writeups, or initiative kickoffs.]

title: TL;DR and Big Picture Summary
description: Generate a TL;DR for each document in bullet form, then provide a final section that connects the dots and shows the big picture.
prompt_text: Give me a TL;DR of each document in bullet form, then provide a final section that connects the dots and shows the big picture. [PASTE HERE: several documents on the same topic or initiative.]

title: Toast Notifications Setup
description: Add toast notifications to alert users when actions succeed or fail, with transitions and styling.
prompt_text: Add toast notifications using [React Toastify or Headless UI] to alert users when an action succeeds or fails — for example, 'Settings Saved', 'Login Failed', or 'New Project Created'. Include fade-in/out transitions.

title: Tool Deprecation Memo
description: Write an internal memo explaining the rationale for replacing a custom deployment tool with GitHub Actions.
prompt_text: Draft an internal memo to the engineering team explaining why we chose to deprecate our custom deployment tool and move to GitHub Actions. Include what we did, why we did it, alternatives we explored, and what's coming next.

title: Top Insights Theme Synthesis
description: Extract the top 3 insights from each document and combine them into one overall takeaway per theme.
prompt_text: Help me extract the top 3 insights from each of these documents, then combine those into one overall takeaway per theme. [PASTE HERE: research, reports, interviews, or strategy writeups.]

title: Trunk-Based Development at Scale
description: Examine the evolution of trunk-based development in large organizations, including tooling requirements and cultural adaptations.
prompt_text: Summarize the evolution of trunk-based development in large orgs. Who uses it at scale today (e.g., Google, Shopify)? What supporting tooling is required (e.g., merge queues, test orchestration)? What cultural or process shifts are necessary?

title: Tutorial Checklist
description: Break a tutorial into a checklist of actions with expected outcomes for each step.
prompt_text: Break this tutorial into a checklist of actions with expected outcomes for each step.

title: Typography Spacing Balance
description: Adjust fonts and spacing in a UI to improve readability and visual balance.
prompt_text: Can you adjust the fonts and spacing in this app so it's easier to read and looks more balanced?

title: UI Animation Integration
description: Add balanced animations to UI elements using specified animation libraries or CSS transitions.
prompt_text: Add animations to this UI using (CSS transitions / Framer Motion / GSAP) — just enough to make interactions feel lively but not distracting.

title: UI Color Layout Improvements
description: Suggest color and layout improvements to create a cleaner, more visually appealing interface.
prompt_text: Here's my current UI: (paste code or describe it). Can you suggest color and layout improvements to make it feel cleaner?

title: UI Modernization Polish
description: Clean up and modernize a messy UI to create a more polished and professional appearance.
prompt_text: This UI feels kind of ugly or messy. Can you clean it up and make it look more modern and polished?

title: Unit Test Walkthrough
description: Walk through creating a unit test for a function, what cases to cover, and why each matters.
prompt_text: I want to write a unit test for this function: [paste code]. Walk me through creating the test, what cases to cover, and why each one matters.

title: User-Friendly Table Enhancement
description: Make table components more user-friendly with sticky headers, row styling, and responsive behavior.
prompt_text: Make this table component more user-friendly by adding sticky headers, alternating row colors, and mobile-friendly behavior.

title: User Needs Theme Summary
description: Identify the most frequently mentioned problems, goals, or user needs across documents and create a summary that shows patterns or themes.
prompt_text: Identify the most frequently mentioned problems, goals, or user needs across these docs. Create a summary that shows patterns or themes. [PASTE HERE: user feedback, internal strategy docs, customer call transcripts, or surveys.]

title: User Settings Page React
description: Build a complete user settings page with editable fields, validation, and confirmation toasts.
prompt_text: Build a user settings page using React. Include editable fields for name, email, and password. When a user updates their info, show a confirmation toast. Add simple validation (e.g., email format) and disable the save button unless there are changes.

title: Variable Flow Tracer
description: Track how variables move and transform through a codebase from declaration to consumption
prompt_text: Act as a developer trying to trace how a value moves through the system. Follow this variable from where it's declared to where it's consumed, and explain each transformation along the way. Use this context: [PASTE HERE: a function, plus any related files].

title: Version Comparison Change Highlighter
description: Compare two versions of a document, highlighting what changed, what was removed, and whether updates improve clarity, alignment, or accuracy.
prompt_text: Compare these two versions of the same document. Highlight what changed, what was removed, and whether the updates improve clarity, alignment, or accuracy. [PASTE HERE: v1 and v2 of a doc, draft, or plan.]

title: Visual Layout Balance
description: Review and improve spacing and alignment in layouts for better visual balance.
prompt_text: The spacing and alignment in this layout feels off. Can you review it and suggest fixes for cleaner visual balance?

title: 3-Step Visual Workflow
description: Create a 3-step visual workflow for a product development process, using icons and clean diagrams.
prompt_text: Create a 3-step visual workflow for a product development process, using icons and clean diagrams.

title: Weekly PR Changelog Generator
description: Create a GitHub Action that summarizes recently merged pull requests and updates a changelog file.
prompt_text: I want a GitHub Action that summarizes all pull requests merged in the past 7 days and generates a CHANGELOG.md entry. Output should include PR titles, authors, and links.

title: Weekly Team Update Presentation
description: Summarize updates into a weekly team presentation with one slide per key theme, including callouts for action items or blockers.
prompt_text: Summarize these updates into a weekly team presentation with one slide per key theme. Keep it short and skimmable, but include callouts for action items or blockers. [PASTE HERE: doc, Slack summary, or Notion update.]

title: Whitepaper Explainer
description: Explain a whitepaper like to a technical stakeholder with 5 minutes to spare.
prompt_text: Explain this whitepaper like I'm a technical stakeholder with 5 minutes to spare.

title: Workflow Best Practices Review
description: Review GitHub Actions workflows to suggest improvements for caching, job separation, and conditionals.
prompt_text: Can you review this GitHub Actions YAML and suggest any best practices I'm missing — like caching, job separation, or conditionals?

title: Workflow Permissions Troubleshoot
description: Analyze and fix GitHub Actions permissions errors by diagnosing the YAML configuration.
prompt_text: Help me debug this GitHub Action that keeps failing with a permissions error. I'll paste the error and YAML — walk me through what's going wrong.
